meanings.definition: To make a commitment that is beyond one's ability to fulfill.
meanings.sent1: She always overcommits to too many tasks and ends up feeling overwhelmed.
meanings.sent2: He tends to overcommits to social events, causing him to be late or miss some altogether.
meanings.sent3: The student overcommits to studying every subject, but ends up not having enough time for any.
meanings.sent4: Her schedule overcommits her to various activities, leaving no time for relaxation.
meanings.sent5: The company overcommits to unrealistic deadlines, leading to rushed and poor quality work.

meanings.definition: To pledge or promise more than is feasible or realistic.
meanings.sent1: He often overcommits to helping others, even when he has limited time himself.
meanings.sent2: She tends to overcommits to attending every social gathering, but then cancels last minute.
meanings.sent3: The politician overcommits to solving all issues in the community, but struggles to deliver on promises.
meanings.sent4: Their budget overcommits to unnecessary expenses, leaving little room for essential ones.
meanings.sent5: The team overcommits to winning every game, but sometimes falls short due to lack of preparation.
